Setting up ClearSky

With the next few pages we’ll try and help you setup your mliti-pollutions sensing system.

Depending on your familiarity with the Raspberry Pi, the process may take up to 15 minutes.

First up, you need to get a Raspberry Pi with internet connectivity.

  • The latest model (Raspberry Pi 3B) comes equipped with Wifi and ethernet
  • The Pi 0 also comes with Wifi, but is slower
  • Finally, you can also buy a Wifi adapter and plug it into any Raspberry Pi
    • We recommend heading over to https://projects.raspberrypi.org for a quick tutorial on getting started.

    To have an accurate estimate of the air quality in your area, you’ll need to buy sensors for the most common types of pollutants. For an out-of-the-box solution, use the following sensors : SDS011 : details DHT22 : details MQ2 : details

    A minimal amount of coding is necessary if you wish to add differents sensors, but we’ll be glad to help at https://github.com/capteurPollutions/Embedded.

    Please clone or download from github in your Raspberry Pi :

  • mkdir ~/ClearSky
  • cd ~/ClearSky
  • git clone https://github.com/CapteursPollution/Embedded
  • cd Embedded/Installation/RaspberryPi/ && sudo sh setup.sh

    • After restarting, your Raspberry should now start reading the data from the sensors.
